turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I want to talk to both you guys about Greta.  And...

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I'm very fucking sorry, but Greta is dead today.  Could we interest you in someone else?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I thought about that.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: She must've fallen asleep at the table...

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Then get out!

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Mark!

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Do you think I'm an idiot...for being in love with her?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Nobody thinks that.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Maybe it was her mother who killed her, with all that Polly Perfect shit.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: It wasn't her mother.  The only reason we're still here is that none of us has slept since the grad party.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Tell me some more about this Krueger guy.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Why don't I go make some coffee.  There's a lot to tell.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Who's Jacob?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: My baby!

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: What, you named it already?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Whoa, slow down.  How're you gonna hide from a guy like that, leave the planet?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I don't know!

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I'm going to see what else I can find out about Mr. Fred Krueger

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I couldn't do that, Mark.  He's my last link with Dan...No, I want him.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Then we'll find another way.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: They think I'm nuts.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: That's their problem.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: No, it's our problem, Mark.  If I don't deal with this, they really might try to take Jacob.  You said she committed suicide?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: That's what the newspapers thought.  She spent the rest of her life in the asylum. After Krueger's trial she flipped out and hung herself, so they thought.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Meaning?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: They couldn't prove it.  No body!  Nuns bumping themselves off is bad for business.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: But I've seen her grave.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Empty plot.  Memorial stone.  Vacant. They never did put her under.  Cool, huh?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Poor woman...

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: No shit.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: She killed herself.  Her soul's gonna be in torment.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Yeah, when are you gonna come to your senses?

turns.speaker: GRETA
turns.text: Next life.  Oh, what's that?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: My undying love.  Have some.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Meet me later.  Milkshakes.  Cherry pie. Banana splits.  And no mom!

turns.speaker: GRETA
turns.text: Pimples, heartburn, cellulite... and no modeling career.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: That club sucks, they card everybody. Let's just party at your place.

turns.speaker: GRETA
turns.text: You know my mother -- get real.  What about Alice's?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: He's right.  Sometimes I feel like I'm living with Melicertes.

turns.speaker: GRETA
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Oh, he was this ancient guy I read about who like, killed his kids 'cause they didn't want to run the kingdom the way he thought they should.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Oh man!  I could've gone all night without looking at that.

turns.speaker: GRETA
turns.text: I don't believe this... All that gore you paint in the comics and you're squeamish?

turns.speaker: GRETA
turns.text: These things are wild...  What do you think?

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: Makes you look like a nun--

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: All right kids, I tell you what we're gonna do.  I've got swimming practice until six-thirty today...

turns.speaker: GRETA
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: That means they're gonna give me the key to the pool so I can lock up when I'm done.

turns.speaker: GRETA
turns.text: Have another one, sounds like you need it.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: Naah, I'm done.  Got to be on shift in a couple hours.  Aren't you going in?

turns.speaker: GRETA
turns.text: Nah.  It's getting too cold for me, and my wonderful mother will kill me if I screw up my hair.  She's got some model agency guy coming to dinner tomorrow night.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: Stop saying that, it's bullshit.

turns.speaker: GRETA
turns.text: I want to talk about the baby.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: Look.  Dan's parents were pushing him. Pushing him hard.  He was bitching about it at the party last night.  He was under pressure.  We all are.

turns.speaker: GRETA
turns.text: Pushy parents can make you more than a bit crazy.

turns.speaker: GRETA
turns.text: Bottom line, Alice.  Anybody, supernatural or not, that wants to hurt you - he'll have to go through us first.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: All of us.  Right?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Dan.  And he's taking Alice with him -- pretty good dive Yvonne.  You've been practicing.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: Two hours a day, six days a week.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: Vomit?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Faint.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Why don't you shut up and let her talk! Two of us died in the last two days, does that strike you as particularly normal?!

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: Mark...

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I'm not finished - I loved Greta.  A lot. And if maybe, just maybe, someone or some thing killed her, I'd like to hear about it!

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: I can't listen to this.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: It's okay.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Stick around, please?

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: You, too?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: He invited me to his house last night.

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: I should have suspectcd, when I heard that 'Doctor.'  I thought it was your father.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: It was supposed to be.  Dad had a heart attack, two days ago.

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: How is he - ?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: It was moderate.  He'll be all right.  But it was out of the question, his coming along.

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: And they thought <u>you</u> could re- place the Skipper?

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: You could train someone else.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Not in two days.  Look:  Do you think I <u>wanted</u> to come?  If it didn't mean so much to Dad - proving his depth-explorer - it's the last thing I'd want!

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Your 'out.'  This came for you.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: My father!  He's not - ?

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Dead?  Matter of fact, he's much better. He's left the hospital.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: What did you mean:  I'm 'out?'

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Your father can be in Nome, Alaska, tomorrow.  We have two choices: Ask them to send him out in a 'copter', and take you off, or the Shark can put back into Nome...

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: You 'trade school boys' are all alike, aren't you?  Anybody who doesn't happen to think like a little gold-braided puppet is, ipso facto, a coward!

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: <u>You</u> said it.  But I won't argue -

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Wearing a uniform doesn't bestow an automatic monopoly on courage, <u>Commander</u>!  It just so happens I'm <u>not</u> a coward - physical or mental - and before I'd risk my father's life...

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: We're <u>all</u> risking our lives!

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: That may be.  But Dad stays where <u>he</u> is, and I'm staying here!

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: You're really a mixed-up oddball, aren't you?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Perhaps.  But the idea of willingly going to <u>school</u> to spend my <u>life</u> at a Paleozoic pastime that should have disappeared with the thunder-lizards - I'm referring to War - <u>that</u> strikes me as the <u>worst</u> cowardice of all - being spiritually yellow!

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: You mean <u>nothing</u> is worth fighting for?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Peace - the dignity of man - the destiny of the human spirit!  Show me a man who says you win <u>those</u> by fighting wars, and <u>I'll</u> show you an idiot!

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: You may not <u>win</u> them.  But without men like your father, to 'degrade' himself by fighting to preserve them - or as much as we have of them - they'd have disappeared, <u>long</u> ago!

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Unidentified Flying Objects.

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Then...this is a 'flying saucer?'

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: That's enough, Holloway.  I've told you before, wearing boards on your shoulders, and parading with a stiff spine doesn't auto- matically endow you with back- bone - !

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: - any more than being the son of Captain Neilsen does!

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: However our ideas disagree, as I've said before, I'm <u>not</u> a coward!  And it happens you've got no choice:  Either <u>I</u> take you down there, in the Lungfish, or you don't get there -

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: I'd sooner swim!

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: They're so remote - cold - beautiful, the stars.  But now - I wonder -

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Which is the one - we have to worry about?

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Maybe - just 'maybe' - when their ship doesn't return - they'll decide not to come here, after all.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: But if they <u>do</u>?

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: I wouldn't worry.  So long as we have boats like the Tiger Shark - and people like you, the Skipper, Dave, Kent, Sir Ian and my father -

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: And his 'egghead' son!  We'll give 'em a <u>rough</u> <u>reception</u>, won't we?

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Now, Dave Old Buddy, you know you're exaggerating -  What do you think of this husband of yours?  On most boats a certain loyalty exists between the Exec and his Navigation and Firing Officer.  But unfortunately, in the case of Lieutenant Dave Milburn of the Tiger Shark and myself -

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: But Julie's a nice girl, and I've seen you work.  She deserves a fighting chance!

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Helen.  I appeal to you -

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Reef!

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: So they caught up with you, too?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: At the worst possible moment. Tomorrow is Janie's birthday. Poor little kid has looked forward for two months to having her Daddy home.  Now -

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: <u>That's</u> the worst possible moment?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: What could be worse than disappoint- ing a little girl?

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Disappointing a <u>big</u> girl!

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: You've asked why I stay a bachelor? There goes the best reason I know!

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: I might have a son like <u>that!</u>

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: I guess Skipper Neilsen re- tired before you enrolled at the Academy, didn't he?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: I guess.

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: One of the finest men, and officers, alive.  A real hero - in the best sense of the word - in World War Two.  He taught us Engineering and Design. Fought like a demon to develop atom subs.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: So all of a sudden his only son drops out of school, be- gins making noises like a pacifist.  A real egghead, do-gooder, and crackpot!  'Ban the atom tests!  Junk the nuclear subs!  Spend the mili- tary budgetfor peace!'

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: A lot of people think like that.

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: But <u>they're</u> not Skipper Neilsen's son!  It broke his heart.  Then when some newspapers called Carl 'the honest, sincere son of a war-mongering father' - Captain Neilsen resigned from the Navy.  Oh, he still keeps his hand in - playing around with projects like the 'Lungfish' - but it broke him, all the same.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Have you ever talked to Carl - tried to see his side?

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: 'His' side?  I've seen it, all right. A nice, bright yellow!

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Cyclops?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Sounds like it!  Distress call, from a small freighter, between Ellesmere Island and Greenland. One mayday, then...nothing.

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: We're stuck tight!

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Skipper!  Look at the depth gauge!

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: You've got to let us try, Skipper --

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: 'Us?'

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Reef and I can take the Explorer down, clamp it around the eye, and ---

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: You all wait here.  I'm going inside, take a look.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Not <u>alone</u>, you're not!

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: How about that! The bow drove half through her, but she sealed herself right up.

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: What's more important - there's our problem.  The bow ram - the sawteeth are holding the Shark in the break. If we can cut the ram, the Shark can pull herself loose!

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: I think you're right.

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Go back and tell Dr. Neilsen. Have him report to the Skipper.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Listen!  Hear that?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: I don't hear anything.  Maybe you've been down here too long.  Why don't you go back up and -

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Strange you didn't hear it. OMIT 274F

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Hey - you know somethin'?  It's getting lighter in here!

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: You know - it <u>is</u>?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: And if I didn't <u>know</u> better - I'd swear we were moving!

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Let's get back to work, and maybe we <u>will</u> be, soon.

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: You hear that?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: The sound again?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Where do you think the voice you heard was coming from?

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Somewhere down there?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Wonder where Powell and Carney are?

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: We'll have to look for them later.

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: I'm with <u>you!</u>

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Here - keep these.  It wants me to come alone.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Oh it does???

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Dave - !

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: What's goin' on in here, Lad? What - ?

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: Get ready.  We shove off as soon as Griff reports all the crew aboard.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Right, Skipper.

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: Is there any way out of it?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Seems to be all around...

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: What about down?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: I...don't know!

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: Course and speed?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Speed...about twenty-two knots. Course...due north!

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: A mass of jelly-like stuff came out of the thing, and caught our torpedo!

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: What???

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: What course, Skipper?

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: Right at our one-eyed friend!

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: You better take Powell and Carney with you --

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: The frogmen?

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: With their underwater experience, they'll be invaluable.  Take sidearms, and flare pistols --

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Sidearms?  But the saucer's dead.

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: We hope!

turns.speaker: GRIFF
turns.text: Excuse me, Skipper---

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: Yes, Griff?

turns.speaker: GRIFF
turns.text: All internal repairs completed, and Frogmen report exterior damage minor.

turns.speaker: GRIFF
turns.text: Skipper - could you take a look here...?

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: Something wrong?

turns.speaker: GRIFF
turns.text: The inertial navigation system. Must have been knocked out in the crash.

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: Why do you say that?

turns.speaker: GRIFF
turns.text: We're dead in the water.  But it indicates we're moving!

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: What????

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: We read you!  Go ahead, Doctor!  They're inside the saucer.  It's filled with breathable air!

turns.speaker: KENT
turns.text: Wonderful!

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: That's wonderful, Carl!  Reef thinks they can clear the Shark bow so we can pull ourself loose!

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: Now they feel it...down below.

turns.speaker: KENT
turns.text: Radiation level...constantly rising...

turns.speaker: KENT
turns.text: Excuse me, Captain - there may be one last, desperate chance - a one-in-a-thousand shot...

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: Anything ---

turns.speaker: KENT
turns.text: It's possible I could adapt one of the torpedo guidance systems to the ICBM - so it would 'home' on the saucer when he rises from the Pole.

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: What about time...?

turns.speaker: KENT
turns.text: It doesn't seem possible, but - could it be an electrical storm center - ?

turns.speaker: SIR IAN
turns.text: Under <u>water</u>?

turns.speaker: KENT
turns.text: High-intensity arcs will burn, submerged.  And millions of volts...discharged in random directions...

turns.speaker: SIR IAN
turns.text: ...above Murmansk, and Finland.

turns.speaker: KENT
turns.text: Suppose our theorizing is correct? Then this <u>could</u> be the next danger point!

turns.speaker: SIR IAN
turns.text: What if the Tiger Shark were to anticipate a bit?  Perhaps be lying there waiting - ?

turns.speaker: KENT
turns.text: We took for granted his source of energy was nuclear.  But suppose it isn't at all - what if it's <u>magnetic</u>?

turns.speaker: SIR IAN
turns.text: <u>We</u> harness energy on a small scale by cutting magnetic lines of force.  Maybe Cyclops does it on a <u>super</u> scale....

turns.speaker: KENT
turns.text: The North Pole is the positive end of the biggest magnet of all - the Earth itself!

turns.speaker: SIR IAN
turns.text: ....in such a way as to prevent his returning to it and, as you put it....  ...'recharging his batteries'?

turns.speaker: KENT
turns.text: If we were lucky enough to catch him with his power depleted....

turns.speaker: KENT
turns.text: The radiation level - from the saucer - it's rising!

turns.speaker: SIR IAN
turns.text: What direction does the system indicate?

turns.speaker: SIR IAN
turns.text: As we near the Pole...

turns.speaker: KENT
turns.text: There's got to be an explanation!

turns.speaker: SIR IAN
turns.text: There is.  I believe our friend...Cyclops... is returning to life!

turns.speaker: SIR IAN
turns.text: All ready?

turns.speaker: KENT
turns.text: As ready as we <u>can</u> be!  I'll report to the Skipper.

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Thought you were going to Washington, Skipper.

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: I did go.  Just back.  Reef, these are a couple of our passengers - Sir Ian Hunt, and Dr. Clifford Kent.  My exec, Commander Richard Holloway.

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: I met Dr. Kent, once.

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: I'm - afraid I have some bad news for you, Reef -  You'll have to share quarters, this trip.

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Who with?

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: Dr. Neilsen.  He'll be - -

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: 'Doctor' Neilsen?  When did <u>that</u> happen?

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: It'll be all right.  We're old friends!

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: I think I should have joined the Air Force!

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: Determine extent of damage, immediately.

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: After torpedo room:  Report!

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: You're sure it's Cyclops?

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: Take a look.

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: What's the running time?

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Thirty-four seconds!

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Right <u>at</u> him?

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: That's what I said!

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: But - what can we accomplish?

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: We can <u>ram</u> him!

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: A hundred and eighty fathoms! We can't be sinking that fast....

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: It's the screws, Skipper.  At our declination angle, running in reverse, they're pulling the Shark <u>and</u> Cyclops right to the bottom.

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: And we're at safe maximum depth already....  Stop engines!

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Suppose there's an atmosphere, of some kind, inside Cyclops?

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: If we could get inside the saucer - use our torches - maybe we could cut the Shark loose?

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Straight to the Pole - at almost fifty knots!

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: Nothing we can do, now.

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: What's the corrected bearing to the Magnetic Pole?

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Minus three.

turns.speaker: SAUCER VOICE
turns.text: Remove your weapons, Commander. And come here - alone!

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Come where?

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: That's a <u>face</u>???

turns.speaker: SAUCER VOICE
turns.text: Point of view is everything. To us, <u>your</u> form of life is ugly as we appear to you.

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Tell me something:  Why can <u>I</u> hear you, when the others couldn't?

turns.speaker: SAUCER VOICE
turns.text: My mission is to study various solar systems, and planets - select the most suitable for colonization -

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: - for horrors like yourself?

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Swell!

turns.speaker: SAUCER VOICE
turns.text: Your friend was to remain where he was!

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: He did!

turns.speaker: SAUCER VOICE
turns.text: I am afraid not.  Therefore -

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Why not me?  What am I - the closing act?

turns.speaker: SAUCER VOICE
turns.text: On the contrary.  I want you - unharmed - perfect.

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: SAUCER VOICE
turns.text: I have selected you, to return with me - along with several other specimens, for study.  We will examine you and the others, discover desirable features to incorporate in our 'earth-colonizers.'

turns.speaker: SAUCER VOICE
turns.text: It is a living thing.  When damaged - you would say 'wounded' - it immediately 'heals' itself.

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: That's why no water leaked inside when we rammed you?

turns.speaker: SAUCER VOICE
turns.text: Of course.  But it is time to be- gin the return voyage --

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: To navigate, won't you have to... see your way?

turns.speaker: SAUCER VOICE
turns.text: Obviously.

turns.speaker: REEF
turns.text: <u>That</u> might be a <u>little</u> <u>rough</u>!

turns.speaker: WENDOVER
turns.text: My yeoman will show you to your quarters.

turns.speaker: SIR IAN
turns.text: Thank you.
